user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of response_completed_callback:
```c
static void
response_completed_callback (void *cls,
                             struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                             void **req_cls,
                             enum MHD_RequestTerminationCode toe)
{
  struct UploadContext *uc = *req_cls;
  (void) cls;         /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) connection;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) toe;         /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if (NULL == uc)
    return; /* this request wasn't an upload request */
  if (NULL != uc->pp)
  {
    MHD_destroy_post_processor (uc->pp);
    uc->pp = NULL;
  }
  if (-1 != uc->fd)
  {
    (void) close (uc->fd);
    if (NULL != uc->filename)
    {
      fprintf (stderr,
               "Upload of file `%s' failed (incomplete or aborted), removing file.\n",
               uc->filename);
      (void) unlink (uc->filename);
    }
  }
  if (NULL != uc->filename)
    free (uc->filename);
  free (uc);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (NULL != uc->filename)
    free (uc->filename);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The if (NULL != uc->filename) free(uc->filename); is reachable whenever uc != NULL and uc->filename is non-NULL; the function only returns early when uc == NULL, otherwise control flows through to that check. A violation would occur only if control could never reach that point (for example an unconditional return or infinite loop before it), which is not present here.
